column2: the place is huge and even though we were relegated to the dreaded upper level
column3: service was still good and they were more than accommodating with our many questions and various restrictions. Honey had the gluten free and I dropped the mushrooms from "The Lou" (despite the 'no substitutions' request) and all was good. We each ordered salads and I'm glad we did
column4: seeing as they were both quite tasty (she had the Spinach
column5: I had the House) and that the pizza took quite a while to get to us...but that's deep dish for you.
